text: Hassan has been awarded a Sloan Fellowship for his growing stature in macroeconomics and in behavioural economics.
Lab alumna Giulia Mezzadri has a new paper with Mike, "Sources of Imprecision in Integrated Value Comparisons," available on PsyArXiv: OSF | Sources of imprecision in integrated value comparisons

Mike's visit to Northwestern has included offering a mini-course on "Cognitive Imprecision and Economic Behavior": Erwin Plein Nemmers Prize in Economics: Department of Economics - Northwestern University
Mike delivered this year's Nemmers Prize Lecture at Northwestern: Nemmers Prize Lecture: Department of Economics - Northwestern University
Hanyao is excited to share his job market paper: Calculations Behind Lottery Valuations and paper: Recovering Preferences from Mistakes: An Auxiliary Task Approach.
Ricardo presented his coauthored work with Nikhil, "Climated Maladaptation and the Commons: Groundwater Management in India" also at APPAM and won second place best poster award.

Ricardo presented his job market paper, "Information Frictions and the Market for Climate Adaptation: Evidence from Index Insurance in Colombia" at the APPAM (Association for Public Policy and Analysis Management), WEFIDEV (Webinar Series in Finance and Development), World Bank-KDI Development Impact Conference.

Mike presented work with Lab alumnus Guy Aridor and Rava da Silveira at the Symposium on Machine and Rational Thought, University of Zurich: Symposium on Machine and Rational Thought (SMART) | Department of Economics | UZH
Zhi Hao presented his recent working paper, "To Each Their Own: Heterogeneity in Worker Preferences for Peer Information", at the North American Economic Science Association (ESA) Meeting.
Jiang presented a poster "Rational Evidence Accumulation under Cognitive Resource Constraints" at the Society for NeuroEconomics

The lab is excited to have a new postdoctoral researcher in IAB. Jiang Mao joins us from U Penn, where she completed her PhD dissertation on computational models of vision under Alan Stocker. Welcome Jiang!
Giulia's work A World of Smiles? has been longlisted for the Information is Beautiful Awards 2024!
Giulia's artwork was selected for the cover of Trends in Immunology for the April 2025 issue! Check it out.

Giulia's paper accepted to AISTATS 2025: "Model Selection for Behavioral Learning Data and Applications to Contextual Bandits," co-authored with Julien Aubert, Louis Köhler, Luc Lehéricy, and Patricia Reynaud-Bouret.

Mike's paper with Xuexin Wei (U. Texas), "Representational Geometry Explains Puzzling Error Distributions in Behavioral Tasks" has now been published in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.
Mel Win Khaw and Ziang Li have a new draft of their paper, "Cognitive Imprecision and Stake-Dependent Risk Attitudes," available as an NBER Working Paper.
Arthur and Mike have a new paper, "Imprecise Counting of Observations in" Averaging Tasks Predicts Primacy and Recency Effects, available as a pre-print on bioRXiv.
Lab alumnus Arthur Prat-Carrabin and Mike’s paper, "Endogenous Precision of the Number Sense" has been accepted as a reviewed pre-print by eLife.

Mike’s paper with Simone Blanco Malerba, Aurora Micheli, and Rava Azeredo da Silveira, "Jointly Efficient Encoding and Decoding in Neural Populations" has been published in PLoS Computational Biology.

Silvio's meta-study: Lab alumnus Silvio Ravaioli is an author of a meta-study with Hayley Jach and others, "Individual Differences in Information Demand Have a Low-Dimensional Structure Predicted by Some Curiosity Personality Traits," accepted by Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.
Yeji Sung’s paper with Mike and Rava Azeredo da Silveira, "Optimally Imprecise Memory and Biased Forecasts" has been published in American Economic Review.
Mark at 2024 ESA World Meeting: Mark gave a keynote talk at the 2024 ESA World Meeting in Bogotá. You can watch the presentation on YouTube here.
Lucas at BRIC 2024: Lucas gave a talk at the BRIC 2024 (Bounded Rationality in Choice Conference), sharing insights on Rational Choice Overload.
Welcome to Hanyao Zhang and Patricio Martin Goldstein, who have recently joined the lab!
Dr Shin: Congratulations to Dr. Shin Oblander, now Assistant Professor in Marketing and Behavioral Science at the Sauder School of Business, UBC!
Lucas and Mark's new working paper: Lucas and Mark have a new working paper titled "Rational Choice Overload."
Dr Eddie: Congratulations to Dr. Edward Shore! Eddie has completed his doctorate and will be joining the UNSW Business School at the University of New South Wales as an Assistant Professor.
Dr. Susie: Congratulations to Dr. Susannah Scanlan, who has completed her doctorate and will be joining Capital Fund Management!

Guy's paper "Information-Constrained Coordination of Economic Behavior": Lab alumnus Guy Aridor's paper with Mike and Rava Azeredo da Silveira is now forthcoming in Journal of Economic Dynamics and Control.

Publication Arthur's paper "Imprecise Probabilistic Inference from Sequential Data": Lab alumnus Arthur Prat-Carrabin's paper with Mike, Imprecise Probabilistic Inference from Sequential Data, is now forthcoming in Psychological Review.
Publication Shin's paper "The Language of (Non)replicable Social Science": Shin's paper, The Language of (Non)replicable Social Science, has been accepted for publication in Psychological Science.
